name: The Morocco Foundation
mission: To fight poverty and illiteracy in Morocco's rural areas
theoryOfChange: By providing cost-effective interventions in education (workshops, supplies) and basic needs (water, food, health), the organization aims to prevent school dropout and child labor, ultimately breaking the cycle of poverty.
zakatClaimEvidence: The Morocco Foundation's website, as described in search result [6], lists its charitable actions as "Financial aid (Covid time, Orphan families… )", "Well construction", and "Ramadan food baskets". There is no explicit mention of "zakat" on their website or donation pages, nor any dedicated zakat funds or campaigns.

alignment.rationale: Alignment 36/50: MEDIUM Muslim donor fit, humanitarian cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes for 3+ years

all_citations.claim: The foundation offers various giving methods for donors to support its mission.
The organization reported total revenue of $134,320, a 94.2% program expense ratio, and 8.5 months of working capital.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The foundation earns a solid score due to its high financial efficiency and direct service model, though the overall rating is tempered by low data confidence and a medium alignment for specific donor segments.

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization addresses urgent humanitarian needs in rural Morocco, making it a relevant choice for those interested in poverty alleviation [3]. As a sadaqah-eligible entity, it offers a medium fit for Muslim donors looking to support general charitable causes through various giving methods [1].
dimension_explanations.impact: The foundation demonstrates high financial efficiency with a 94.2% program expense ratio and holds 8.5 months of working capital to ensure operational stability [2][3]. While the cost per beneficiary is calculated at approximately $11.54, the overall data confidence remains low due to limited third-party verification of programmatic outcomes [2].

strengths.detail: The organization directs <cite id="6">94.2% of its total expenses</cite> toward its programs, significantly exceeding the <cite id="11">peer program ratio median of 89.7%</cite>.
The foundation maintains a <cite id="7">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised</cite>, maximizing the impact of every donation.
The ABT-MF Academy initiative was recognized with the <cite id="12">Best Prize in Education</cite> at the WeXchange Forum in 2024.

strengths_deep_dive: The Morocco Foundation's strength lies in its long-term commitment to rural Morocco, having operated for <cite id="2">22 years</cite>. Its financial health is bolstered by <cite id="13">8.5 months of working capital</cite>, providing a comfortable buffer for its specialized programs like <cite id="8">water well construction and themed caravans</cite>. The organization's ability to achieve a <cite id="14">165.2% 3-year revenue CAGR</cite> demonstrates significant growth momentum while maintaining a direct service delivery model.
rich_narrative.summary: The Morocco Foundation is a humanitarian organization dedicated to <cite id="1">alleviating poverty and illiteracy within Morocco's most vulnerable rural communities</cite>. Founded in <cite id="2">2004</cite>, the organization has spent over two decades developing a multi-faceted approach to rural development, ranging from <cite id="3">water well construction</cite> to educational initiatives like the <cite id="4">ABT-MF Academy workshop program</cite>. Despite its relatively modest scale, reporting <cite id="5">$134,320 in total revenue</cite> in 2023, the foundation maintains an exceptionally lean operational model. Financial records indicate a <cite id="6">program expense ratio of 94.2%</cite>, ensuring that nearly every dollar donated is converted into direct service delivery. This efficiency is further highlighted by a <cite id="7">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised</cite>, suggesting that the organization relies on low-cost, grassroots mobilization rather than expensive marketing campaigns. Beyond education, the foundation conducts <cite id="8">themed caravans and social actions</cite>, including the distribution of <cite id="9">Ramadan food baskets</cite> to families in need. The organization's impact is characterized by a highly cost-effective model, with internal metrics suggesting a cost of approximately <cite id="10">$11.54 per beneficiary</cite>, a figure that ranks highly for the humanitarian sector.
